summary: Welding and other "hot work" involved in U.S. Navy ship maintenance means a significant risk of fire. In 2020, a Navy ship caught fire, suffering over $3 billion in damage. This spurred Navy action to improve fire safety in ship maintenance. Still, two key factors undercut the Navy's progress. Staffing shortages across key organizations mean more reliance on sailors, who have other duties, to prevent...
title: Navy Ship Maintenance: Fire Prevention Improvements Hinge on Stronger Contractor Oversight
